info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.
info.title: FHIR Medication Administration resource API documentation

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Resource data
parameters.description: The request body should be a valid data payload.

parameters.name: If-None-Exist
parameters.description: Specify the search query for conditional create.

400.description: MedicationAdministration could not be parsed or failed basic FHIR validation rules

422.description: The MedicationAdministration resource violated applicable FHIR profiles or server business rules.

post.description:
Create a new MedicationAdministration with a server assigned id.

FHIR documentation for MedicationAdministration.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Resource data
parameters.description: The request body should be a valid data payload.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Return administrations of this medication code

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: Return administrations with this administration device identity

parameters.name: effectivetime
parameters.description: Date administration happened (or did not happen). The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Return administrations that share this encounter

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Return administrations with this external identifier

parameters.name: medication
parameters.description: Return administrations of this medication resource

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The identity of a patient to list administrations  for

parameters.name: practitioner
parameters.description: Who administered substance

parameters.name: prescription
parameters.description: The identity of a prescription to list administrations from

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: MedicationAdministration event status (for example one of active/paused/completed/nullified)

parameters.name: wasnotgiven
parameters.description: Administrations that were not made

400.description: MedicationAdministration could not be parsed or failed basic FHIR validation rules (or multiple matches were found).

412.description: The given criteria is not selective enough.

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing MedicationAdministration based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.
